comments.body: Camman18???
CAMMAN RAID
Please make minecarts faster!!!!!! I can't take it anymore.
How about it can't be put on helmets, because helmets are supposed to protect mobs from burning in sunlight.

I was about to write this idea, glad that someone already did that. Allow me to expand this: This enchantment will cause players that fight with potions be at advantage against others, so healing will hurt, but harming potions will heal the player. Because of this, this curse should also gives the player the hunger effect (zombies are always hungry), so there is a huge trade-off by using this enchantment, as it is a cursed one, after all.
It would be perfect for potentially a new kind of ruin in the Mangrove swamp like the ruined Jungle temple.

Like what specifically? More fruit trees, radishes, turnips, corn, peas, beans, grapes, tomatoes, raspberries, strawberries, gourds other than pumpkins, cantaloupe, honeydew, purple carrots, etc. Obviously not all of these, but which ones are you thinking and why?

Better you make some suggestions. I think something like onions for adding to process some food. Or garlic which could give an effect.

Pickles maybe, or someone mentioned rice in another thread.
I personally want tomatoes. They could act like berry bushes that do not damage you, and tomatoes can be turned into rotten tomatoes, which act like snowballs except they can knock players back.
yes
I was wondering about rice plants, tomatoes, strawberry bush blueberry bush raspberries, and cherry trees.
Cool maybe just "Healing" no ?
Why stop there?

I like the idea of armor that uses XP for healing the player - it gives the upcoming sculk blocks more significance and use, as well as XP farms and Bottles o' Enchanting. To avoid it becoming overpowered, what if it was an enchantment only available for the chestplate? Both the helmet and boots already have specific enchantments, and since player health is represented by hearts, the chestplate, which in real life protects the heart, seems like an obvious choice.

Perhaps this could be added to ancient city loot to make going down there more worthwhile?
I think just "Healing" is perfect...
Man, this is a great idea! but it shouldn't be too overpowered, I could see the way you could just spam mobs in a pinch and survive.
What an interesting concept! However, I think to prevent this from being OP, it shouldn't be compatible with Mending since they both use XP.

Jam seems like a cool idea- you could make it with a bottle, and maybe utilize sugar too. (Seeing as sugar also seems pretty underutilized- you basically only need it for pumpkin pie and cake.) ...Though it does, of course, raise the question of what one would use the jam for...
What if they could heal half a heart when eaten, regardless of hunger bar level? They would have to be made harder to find but it would be a cool game feature.
Or maybe replace one of the milk buckets in the cake recipe

I like the regenerating defense idea- there'd have to be specific circumstances under which it could occur though. ...Maybe Sweet Berries, and everyone's favorite dirt variant could be given a better purpose together.

In short, if Sweet Berries are planted on Coarse dirt, a mature sweet berry has a small chance of planting a new sweet berry plant on an adjacent coarse dirt block. This could allow for natural patches of sweet berries to occur in Taigas, but would otherwise mean Sweet Berries only spread if you plant them deliberately.
you could put it on bread to make toast or bread with jam, and the jar would be kinda like a glass bottle.
I think you should be able to trade them to villagers for emeralds to the farmer would bring a use

Wood, stone & iron hoes take longer to break crops. (iron can instabreak beetroot)

The pitch fork should break 3 wheat at a time instantly, has 1700 durability, 3 damage, 2 speed
Enchantments: harvest efficiency- only available on hoes/pitchforks, you break 2x as many crops in a swing.
Water does not break wheat or beetroot.

I think a watering can could be a great idea it will work less than regular bone meal so that composting doesn't go away I think to balance all these foods we will add we will need to re work the food system, maybe add cravings that you will randomly have that if you eat the food you are craving you will get extra saturation
Currently, farming is simple and boring. Adding some difficulty to it would give it more of a survival feel.
that doesn't sound minecraft-y
Yes they should do this

GREAT IDEA! Always wanted to connect minecarts together, and I never thought of the light idea but I LOVE IT! Building railways in Minecraft is one of my fav things to do, and this would make that even better! This would be awesome Mojang!

It’s a bloody brilliant idea. I wanted to suggest this as well and also wanted to craft them using copper and chains. The recipe could’ve been a copper ingot and a piece of chain placed side by side to creat the connector, then you craft the connector with a minecart side by side to create a connector minecart. You could also craft a dual connector minecart by placing a minecart in the middle of the crafting table and two connectors on each side. Then you place the cart on the tracks and connect them. It’s genius! Thank you for suggesting it!
More people need this in there lives. Thank you for speaking out about this.
I would absolutely LOVE this. I had this idea earlier today and was stumped on how to go about it, I think you nailed it! :D
Yes! Or just modify the stone cutter to be able to cut wood. Also the cutters should be able to damage mobs. You could make mob defenses with it or pvp bases.
Yes! Or you could just modify the existing stone cutter to be able to cut wood. It should also be able to damage mobs. It could be used as a mob defense or as a PVP base defense.

What will you do with it? The wood crafting recipes are already easy, like for example, the smoker only needs four logs. Really, the most a crafting recipe could ever use is 9 logs, and for stairs, you need 6 planks for four stairs, which for 6 planks you only need two logs, which can be mined in seconds. A lot of wood recipes need sticks, which are extremely easy to get, one log can give you 8 sticks. That can almost fill up all the space in a crafting table. The sawmill is not necessary.
Interesting idea, the game would benefit from this, it will be more concise
I find this idea lovely! Good thinking!
I hope that would also mean the books on the texture also would be rearranged
PLEASE.
This would be so cool right??!?!?
I wonder what its enchantment name should be
if you had an enderman farm you would have way way way too much xp

having XP boost enchant could be great, maybe making it findable only in ancient cities since they are kinda related to "alien" stuff with XP related storing blocks.. definetly mutually exclusice to looting
concerns about "having mob farm makes it too easy to make XP with this" I would say.. having mob farm itself makes it easy to have tons of XPs anyway, and also drops yet none complains on looting enchant
name could be simply "XP boost" as that one mod used it, it is super explanatory, or it could be something as "educational" or whatever more interesting word with similar meaning can be found
Yes, like pinecones. They explode when on fire, which is how they plant their seeds. :)

I like this idea.

The drop rates for charcoal should be:

  • 95% (any block made of wood)
  • 15% (any leaf block)

There should definitely be naturally generating castles (not too big), and chariots would be cool too if done properly.
Siege weapons would not work, as they would have to be larger than one block. This would create too much complication, as one of minecraft’s core mechanics is ‘one action affects one block’. Another problem with siege engines is that they take creativity out of building one yourself. You could build a cannon if you wanted too, and there are many ways to do it - building a good one is very impressive. If you could create one by placing a single block, this would be taken away. Mojang have already discounted cannons for this reason.
it would be really good
Notch actually said they would be added back in the day, but he never got a chance to add them, so that window has already been LONG gone.
Good idea, but what would the crafting recipes be?
Chariots aren’t siege weapons, and you forgot to include trebuchets, but yeah, I agree.
I really want a ballista.
If you fall onto them from 3 blocks or higher without crouching, you should fall trough them

You can, using named banners. They show up as a label on the map. That being said, I would love to have an item like a beacon that shows on a map and also renders no matter where you are in the world. It would be a vanilla alternative to journeymap waypoints and I think would make exploration a lot more convenient.
you can already use the map on the flag, which will leave a mark on the map
Or in survival there will be pirates in the ocean that drive boats.

that is very sensible i like it but i think you should be able to do it with any wood it would just affect the colour e.g. if you used blue on birch it would come out light blue but if you used blue on dark oak it would come out a shade of navy

This could add to the existing threads of paint on it's own and the ability to paint blocks.  The original concept of painting blocks would be to paint one side of a block for a wall, without having to double wall or split the blocks.  

 

Dying the blocks is a different concept as it would dye the entire block, not just one face of it.  Nice concept, and it could allow for more new colors like navy, olive or salmon (to name a few) that the game doesn't currently have.
Yeah! Cob would be an amazing addition to Minecraft in my opinion, it could come in the 1.19 wild update or something and you could craft it using 2 mud blocks and 2 hay blocks to create 4 cob blocks

I think this would be something most people don't realize they'd want until they get it. It would be so useful! In addition, non-smeltable items shouldn't be able to be placed in the top part of a furnace in the first place. Not that it would help much until we get movable block entities, since the hopper would still get clogged and require manual cleanout.
Totally agree! This would be really nice. If the item isn't smeltable and there is a hopper underneath, it passes through.
Agreed. If a non-smeltable item can enter. Furnace, it should be able to leave the furnace. This would increase productivity especially on SMP/Realms.

I agree, however, one could also argue that many items should not even be able to be placed in a furnace in a first place. I found emeralds, arrows, etc can all be placed in the top, but obviously can't be smelted. There are also a few items that can go in the "fuel" slot, but can not be burned. Like why can't we burn signs, trapdoors, etc. There's many combustible items that you can't place in the fuel slot.

I would argue it's well past time the furnace was updated appropriately. I can't believe how poor auto smelting and filtering systems still are in minecraft.

I, like you, like to use auto smelting for various farms. For a gold farm, might I suggest using 2 or 3 filters for each stackable item type. Then your blast furnaces wont get clogged.
Lo he estado pensando desde el año pasado, sería una genial adición y sería aún mejor si hubiera una variante de piglin que lance hachas también, enriquecería más al Lore del juego
yes this would be awesome
Also would be a good way to chain boats together to make ocean hauls more efficient, and players more mobile.
